column4: Indicators

column2: P129038 Army Initial Foundation Training (AIFt) Module C (218613)

column2: P114268 Land Materiel Operator Maintenance Supervisor
column4: 1. Understand the scope of LMSF maintenance activities
2. Determine WHS requirements for LMSF activities
3. Identify all roles and responsibilities of a LMSF supervisor including the availability of user Handbooks and user instructions are current in a sub-unit and below
4. Articulate to others their roles and responsibilities within the LMSF
5. Demonstrate effective supervision of subordinates during their conduct of LMSF roles
6. Manage and store all required LMSF documentation IA workplace conventions including Non-techniquical inspections, repair requests, and technical servicing and repair
7. Manage equipment servicing programs, schedules and records IAW LMSF policy
8. Ensure compliance with the requirements of the Engineering/Management System Directive
9. Understand technical certifications of direct purchased land materiel
10. Identify and co-ordinate LMSF training requirements

column3: MA-RA-B-INT - Conduct Explosive Ordanance Processes as an Ammunitation Safety Supervisor
column4: 1. Demonstrate the ability to understand the duties of the Ammunition Safety Supervisor
2. Demonstrate an understanding of unit level paperwork for the receipt, issue and return of ammunition and explosive ordnance in accordance with organisational requirements.
3. Demonstrate the ability to examine and certify packaging free from explosive ordnance in a safe manner in accordance with organisational requirements including:
4. Prepare suitable location to conduct inspection
5. Identify explosive contaminants
6. Identify and apply relevant labels and markings
7. Conduct physical examinations of EO and associated packaging
8. Certify as free from explosives
9. Return to Depot requirements for 66MM HEAT M72A6 and M18A1 (Claymore)
1. Apply the WHS policy to the workplace
2. identify and report hazards and/or incidents
3. Manage incidents and hazards
4. Implement control measures
5. Respond to incidents
6. Control an incident scene (REACT)

column3: MA-GA-B-INT - Review general range saefty for CAT 1-7 practices
column4: 1. Identify types of military ranges
2. State requirements for firing non-ADF service weapons
3. Identify duties of a range control officer
4. Identify people who may be appointed OIC practice
5. State responsibilities for conduct of weapon training tests
6. State when firing must cease
7. Identify ammunition handling and accountability responsibilities
8. State safety requirements when clearing weapons
9. State the requirements for placing range flags
10. State safety staff responsibilities during night firing and NVG practices
11. State hearing protection requirements
12. State SS ratios during different practices
13. Identify the medical and emergency support requirements
14. State the characteristics of and number of firers on a 25m range
15. Identify actions on in the event of an emergency/unsafe practices
16. Identify Gallery practice requirements
17. Identify requirements for SMG 25m practices
18. Describe the warning and range clearance procedures on conclusion of the practice.

column3: MA-GA-C-INT - Conduct the duties of a safety supervisor at a CAT 1-7 practice
column4: 1.  Ensures firers under their direct supervision weapons' are pointed down range during load/unload procedure
2. Ensure firers under their direct supervision have the correct PPE fitted
3. Ensure firers under their direct supervision are aligned to the correct target
4. Ensure the safety catch of firers under their direct supervision is applied correctly during movement between positions or firing points
5. Ensure a firer under their direct supervision follows the emergency stop procedure, if implemented
6. Observe the firers under their direct supervision to ensure the firer’s rounds are striking the bullet catch
7. Ensure a firer under their direct supervision performs the correct weapon drills
8. Conducts weapon clearance of firers from the firing point under their direct supervision
9. Takes all reasonable steps to ensure that there are no injuries to personnel
10. Takes all reasonable steps to ensure that there is no damage to equipment
11. Takes all reasonable steps to ensure that WHS policy and range procedures are adhered to
12. Takes all reasonable steps to ensure that there are no security breaches
13. Describe the SS duties with firers upon arrival at the firing position.
14. Conducts a safety brief to the butts party
15. Detail a marker to each target frame
16. Establishes and maintains communication with the OIC practice
17.Ensures members of the butts party do not expose themselves above the mantlet during firing
18. Raise and lower the flags IAW applicable Range Standing Orders
19. Observes the butts stop for fires and takes measures to extinguish as appropriate
20. Accurately records and relays scores as requires
21. Ensures the butts party patches-out targets and refurbishes the butts area at the completion of the practice
22. Takes all reasonable steps to ensure that there were no reasonably preventable injuries to personnel
23. Takes all reasonable steps to ensure that there was no damage to equipment
24.Takes all reasonable steps to ensure that WHS policy and range procedures were adhered to
25. Takes all reasonable steps to ensure that there were no security breaches.
26. Conducts a safety brief to the butts party
27. Detail a marker to each target frame
28. Establishes and maintains communication with the OIC practice
29. Ensures members of the butts party do not expose themselves above the mantlet during firing
30. Raise and lower the flags IAW applicable Range Standing Orders
31. Observes the butts stop for fires and takes measures to extinguish as appropriate
32. Accurately records and relays scores as requires
33. Ensures the butts party patches-out targets and refurbishes the butts area at the completion of the practice
34. Takes all reasonable steps to ensure that there were no reasonably preventable injuries to personnel
35. Takes all reasonable steps to ensure that there was no damage to equipment
36. Takes all reasonable steps to ensure that WHS policy and range procedures were adhered to
37. Takes all reasonable steps to ensure that there were no security breaches.

column3: MA-GA-D-INT - Conduct the duties of an OIC at a CAT 1-7 practice
column4: 1. Inteprets signs for the range
2. Understand an RDA trace overlay supplied by Range Control and follow applicable restrictions on the range
3. Conduct a range clearance IAW doctrine
4. Locate and site administration, ammunition, waiting areas, etc.
5. Oversee set up of range layout and areas
6. Meet medical pre-requisites
7. Ensure only approved weapon types and ammunition natures listed on the range detail are used
8. Candidate confirms that all firers present have completed a weapon training test prior.
9. Ensure firers are qualified on weapon types for practice.
10. Ensure that SS are qualified on range detail weapon types and Permanent Basic Ranges
11. Ensure only approved weapon types and ammunition natures listed on the range detail are used
12. Meets safety vehicle and ammunition transport requirements
13. Deliver brief to firers
14. Controls movement of personnel IAW extant doctrine
15. Controls raising and lowering of the butts flag if necessary
16. Conduct rehearsals as required
17. Gains permission to commence and cease practice
18. Security is maintained throughout the practice
19. Supervise communications requirements internally and to Range Control
20. Conducts the practice IAW the guidelines detailed in the Range Detail
21. Issues correct words of command for loading and unloading
22. Corrects the Safety Supervisor in the event that he/she allows any unsafe procedure to occur without intervention
23. Ensures that all firers are wearing correct aural protection IAW WHS and range regulations
24. Ensures all firers wear required PPE
25. Account for and control ammunition
26. Control safe movement on and off the range
27. Ensures that clearances are conducted at the completion of each detail
28. Takes all reasonable steps to ensure that there are no injuries to personnel
29. Takes all reasonable steps to ensure that there is no damage to equipment
30. Takes all reasonable steps to ensure that WHS policy and range procedures are adhered to
31. Clears all personnel onto and off the range as required throughout the practice
32. Ensures that sentries are posted and briefed IAW ADF LRS policy
32. Describes the administrative actions required prior to the conduct of a range
33. Identifies checks to be made prior to opening the range
33. dentifies key actions that need to occur prior to opening the range
34. States actions that must occur prior to leaving the range.
1. Apply RATEL procedures
2. Supervise radio operators
3. Supervise methods of transmission
